lines.text: Madame, there's an Indian in the apartment!
Well, you needn't be so frightened. He's not an Indian. He's only an assassin.
Madame, I'm very tolerant of the manner in which my employers amuse themselves. But when they start filling their apartments with naked assassins - I give my notice.
Use your head, Doreta. He's the fake policeman of last night.

[enters wearing a blanket and looks out of window]
The police still have the block surrounded, I'll have to stay.
There, you see, Doreta. He has to stay.
You'll earn the gratitude of the Party...
I'm no Communist. I worked hard for my savings and I'm splitting with nobody - revolution or no revolution.
Doreta, hand me my robe. If the revolution's coming, I want to be properly dressed for it.
